title: normal patching
body:
i think alot of players are having many problems with patching like 0 kbps speed , stuck at 32% or 99% etc...
so i was thinking if riot make a manual patching option

then we download it and install it without having any problems 
it was just an idea that  i wanted to share because i think if its done it will help alot of players who are having patching issues 
plz share your comments and tell me what do u think 
thx ^.^

replies.body:
This would be the single greatest thing, at least until they get the patcher to not fail for really silly reasons.

But it might confuse players who haven't adapted patches to their system before. And believe me, it can get *really* confusing at times, especially if you're not using a mainstream OS or if you're more than one version behind (which will most definitely regularly happen to some players). How would you be able to anticipate all the files that a person may have missing from their installation from not patching for a while?

good point xD
thanks for the information
I wish it was that simple. I would like to know more about the biggest pain you feel when downloading updates Hatchiepi. Is it the download speed, corrupted files?

i have 2 main problems while patching 
1. the download speed keeps going down until 0 kbps and sometimes forces me to re-update and other times just goes up to regular again
2.  some times there are alot of files scanned it reaches to 6k+

Well, I think I have a fix for these issues.
1. When the download speed goes to 0kbps, the files are usually installing themselves (e.g. at 32mb left). Just leave it for a while and then it will usually finish downloading and updating. You can tell it's doing this by the percentage increasing from time to time. It's rather common, just give it a little time. The worst thing you could do is close the window.
2. This is most likely of you closing the patcher when Issue 1 comes up. The patcher has more files to scan that you've previously downloaded. so to avoid this, don't close the window when patching. The best thing to do to fix this issue (and prevent lots of files being scanned) is to uninstall and reinstall LoL on your computer.

>1. When the download speed goes to 0kbps, the files are usually installing themselves (e.g. at 32mb left). Just leave it for a while and then it will usually finish downloading and updating.

This is true. Which is bad. The patcher has a clear phase where it says "Applying patches..." If there was any point in which a file has to 'install' itself, then it should be done while this message is displayed, lest confused users close the patcher because they think it's become unresponsive. The least that should be done is to activate this message if a file download ever stops because of this reason.
